channel.title: Npc's
channel.description:
I understand how to make npc dialouge i make it alot, but how do i make it so when i click on a npc it opens the dialouge =D , but i have to click on object's or kill npc's to get it up how can i get it up by just clicking on them
is it a code kind of like this 1?
if ((objectID == 12356) && (objectX == 3206) && (objectY == 3222)) except with npc in it? please help =D
[IMG]http://i88.photobucket.com/albums/k193/jake1216_2006/npc.jpg[/img]

item.title: Npc's

callDialogues(466); has a (S) in it you gotta remove the (s)

callDialogue(466); should work

item.title: Npc's
item.dc:creator: @killer75230 killer75230
item.description:
@killer75230 wrote:

this is what i got

i declared these from your guide

public void characterOneLine(String one) { //Gives the method the parameter "String one". sendFrame200(969, 591); sendFrame126(playerName, 970); //Shows the player's name. sendFrame126(one, 971); //The parameter "String one" is displayed here. sendFrame164(968); sendFrame75(pCHead, 969); //Shows the player's head. NpcDialogueSend = true; //Opens the dialogue box. } public void characterTwoLine(String one, String two) { //Gives the method the parameters "String one, String two". sendFrame200(974, 591); sendFrame126(playerName, 975); //Shows the player's name. sendFrame126(one, 976); //The parameter "String one" is displayed here. sendFrame126(two, 977); //The parameter "String two" is displayed here. sendFrame164(973); sendFrame75(pCHead, 974); //Shows the player's head. NpcDialogueSend = true; //Opens the dialogue box. } public void oneLine(String one) { //Gives the method the parameter "String one". sendFrame200(4883, 591); sendFrame126(GetNpcName(NpcTalkTo), 4884); //Shows the N.P.C.'s name. sendFrame126(one, 4885); //The parameter "String one" is displayed here. sendFrame75(NpcTalkTo, 4883); //Shows the N.P.C.'s head. sendFrame164(4882); NpcDialogueSend = true; //Opens the dialogue box. } public void twoLine(String one, String two) { //Gives the method the parameters "String one, String two". sendFrame200(4888, 591); sendFrame126(GetNpcName(NpcTalkTo), 4889); //Shows the N.P.C.'s name. sendFrame126(one, 4890); //The parameter "String one" is displayed here. sendFrame126(two, 4891); //The parameter "String two" is displayed here. sendFrame75(NpcTalkTo, 4888); //Shows the N.P.C.'s head. sendFrame164(4887); NpcDialogueSend = true; //Opens the dialogue box. } public void threeLine(String one, String two, String three) { //Gives the method the parameters "String one, String two, String three". sendFrame200(4894, 591); sendFrame126(GetNpcName(NpcTalkTo), 4895); //Shows the N.P.C.'s name. sendFrame126(one, 4896); //The parameter "String one" is displayed here. sendFrame126(two, 4897); //The parameter "String two" is displayed here. sendFrame126(three, 4898); //The paramter "String three" is displayed here. sendFrame75(NpcTalkTo, 4894); //Shows the N.P.C.'s head. sendFrame164(4893); NpcDialogueSend = true; //Opens the dialogue box. } public void fourLine(String one, String two, String three, String four) { //Gives the method the parameters "String one, String two, String three, String four". sendFrame200(4901, 591); sendFrame126(GetNpcName(NpcTalkTo), 4902); //Shows the N.P.C.'s name. sendFrame126(one, 4903); //The parameter "String one" is displayed here. sendFrame126(two, 4904); //The parameter "String two" is displayed here. sendFrame126(three, 4905); //The parameter "String three" is displayed here. sendFrame126(four, 4906); //The parameter "String four" is displayed here. sendFrame75(NpcTalkTo, 4901); //Shows the N.P.C.'s head. sendFrame164(4900); NpcDialogueSend = true; //Opens the dialogue box. } public void callDialogue(int npc) { //Method with the parameter "int npc". NpcTalkTo = npc; //Sets the value of NpcTalkTo (the current npc being talked to) to the value of the integer "npc" in our parameters. switch (npc) { //Switch statement on the integer "npc". default: //Default case (activates when the method is called and there is no case to handle the value of the integer "npc"). System.out.println("No case to handle the dialogue."); //Delivers a message to tell you of the problem. break; //Prevents the default case from falling through. } }’

Edit - We playing ignore the nub now?

item.title: Npc's
item.dc:creator: @killer75230 killer75230
item.description:
@killer75230 wrote:

Adding for when they die, i can do, i do this

NpcHandler -

[code]
if(npcs[NPCID].npcType == 3493)
{
int Player = npcs[NPCID].StartKilling;
client ppl = (client) server.playerHandler.players[Player];
ppl.sendFrame200(4883, 591);
ppl.sendFrame126(“Colinaromancer”, 4884);
ppl.sendFrame126(“That was but one of my pets…”, 4885);
ppl.sendFrame126(“Click here to continue”, 4888);
ppl.sendFrame75(3492, 4883);
ppl.sendFrame164(4882);
ppl.NpcDialogueSend = true;

} [/code]

]but more from there i cant, and i mean walking up to an Npc and clicking on them, then having it sent to u

I can have it send Frames when something dies or you click on something though

item.title: Npc's
item.dc:creator: @LeScape LeScape
item.description:
@LeScape wrote:

ok, so say you wanted tztok jad to open a menu when he is killed, you would add a case for 2745 (tztok jad) in the method on my tut, then add this in the void process of npchandler.java

for (int p : server.playerHandler.players) {
if (p != null) {
client person = (client) p;
for (int i : maxNPCs) {
if (npcs[i] != null) {
if (npcs[i].npcType == 2745) {
if (npcs[i].IsDead) {
p.callDialogues(2745);
}
}
}
}
}
}

If you wanted it to be another monster besides tztok jad talking, you would add the case of that monsters id and replace the 2745 inside of the p.callDialogues with that monsters id

to make it so when you click them, add it under:

case 155: //first Click npc

Under all of the boolean and int declarations, you would add:

if (NPCID == 2745) { //clicks tztok jad to bring up the menu (not recommended because that's his attack option)
callDialogues(2745);
}

again, whatever monsters face you want to show in the dialogue box is the case you add it under, and the number you put in the callDialogue(number here);

Read full topic

Edit - like i did this

case 466: //945 is the I.D. of the N.P.C. "RuneScape Guide", which is who I want to open this example dialogue. oneLine("Welcome."); //The methods we added earlier, I chose to use oneLine(String) because we only have one word of text. callDialogues(466); break;
